notes: Kosfeld and Rustagi (2015 AER) 'Leader Punishment and Cooperation in Groups: Experimental Field Evidence from Ethiopia'. Field experiment in Ethiopian forest commons. Leaders of forest user groups are classified into behavioral types (conditional cooperators [leq], conditional cooperators with efficiency concerns [leqef], and selfish [las]) based on lab-in-the-field games. Table 6 is the main cross-sectional analysis: OLS regression of group cooperation (pct = forest condition) on leader type dummies with group-level controls and village FE. Table 3 is the experimental punishment analysis using Poisson regression. We define two baseline groups: G1 for the cooperation-leader-type relationship (Table 6, primary claim), and G2 for leader punishment behavior (Table 3). Table 7 (panel FE within leader type over time) is treated as a robustness extension of G1.

design_audit.estimand: ATE of leader behavioral type on group cooperation
design_audit.notes: Leader types are determined by behavior in a one-shot public goods game (exogenous revelation of type). The paper treats these as quasi-random conditional on village: leaders are elected but their experimental type is not known to group members. OLS with robust SE (not clustered). Village FE absorb village-level confounders. Table A7 shows alternative inference including village-clustered SE and wild bootstrap. Dataset has 53 groups total, 51 with non-missing lcode. Analysis sample depends on controls/outcome missingness.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Group cooperation level (forest condition percentage, pct)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Leader behavioral type (leq = conditional cooperator, leqef = conditional cooperator with efficiency concerns, las = selfish), classified via experimental public goods game
claim_object.estimand_concept: Average effect of having a conditional cooperator (vs selfish/other) leader on group cooperation, conditional on group characteristics and village FE
claim_object.target_population: Forest user groups in the Bale region of Ethiopia

baseline_specs.label: Table6-Col3
baseline_specs.notes: Three leader type dummies (leq, leqef, las) entered jointly; omitted category is non-punishment type. Village FE (i.vcode) with 5 villages. Robust SE.

constraints.notes: Paper reveals a progression from 0 controls (Col 1) to 8 (Cols 2-3) to 14 controls (Col 9, adding chet, shet, ginil, lage, ledu, lclanp). The control-count envelope spans this range. Controls are group-level characteristics (common property structure, demographics, economic variables, leader demographics). NOTE: The do-file references 'lclan' but in Leader_Group_AER_2014.dta the actual variable name is 'lclanp'. Stata abbreviation matching resolves this, but Python code must use 'lclanp' explicitly.

canonical.notes: Heteroskedasticity-robust SE, matching the paper's Table 6: reg ... , robust. Table A7 Col 1 confirms this is the baseline.

variants.notes: Clustered at village level (5 villages). Table A7 Col 2 shows this alternative. Very few clusters.

budgets.notes: 14 optional controls (8 baseline + 6 extended). LOO from 8 = 8 specs. Single additions of 6 extended controls = 6 specs. ~4 predefined control sets. 20 random subset draws. Plus sample, form, FE, and joint variations.

sampling.notes: 14 total optional controls in 3 blocks: group_characteristics (ccs, ed, pp, gs, wmk, time, fem, ginic), heterogeneity (chet, shet, ginil), leader_demographics (lage, ledu, lclanp). Random subsets stratified by size (5-12 controls), drawing from the full pool.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Table A3 reports balance across leader types. Reproduce the ANOVA tests.

design_audit.estimand: Treatment effect of experimental condition on leader punishment count
design_audit.notes: Poisson regression of punishment count (pi) on experimental condition dummies (i.cd1), SE clustered at session level (fcode). The experimental conditions vary whether the leader can punish free-riders (efficiency conditions) or unequal contributors (inequality conditions).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Number of punishment points assigned by leader
claim_object.treatment_concept: Experimental condition (efficiency vs inequality frames, varying contribution levels of group members)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of experimental condition on leader punishment behavior (Poisson count model)
claim_object.target_population: Leaders in the experimental punishment game (Ethiopian forest user groups)

baseline_specs.label: Table3-Poisson
baseline_specs.notes: Poisson regression of punishment count on 9 condition dummies (cd1 = 2..10, with cd1=1 as base). SE clustered at session/group level (fcode).

constraints.notes: Footnote 22 adds lage, ledu, lclan as controls. Maximum 3 additional controls.

canonical.notes: Clustered at session/group level (fcode), matching the paper: vce(cluster fcode).

budgets.notes: Secondary claim. Fewer variations. The Poisson model limits some RC axes.
